column2: Grail Damsels, also known as Daughters of the Grail, Daughters of Bretonnia, Handmaidens of the Lady, and formally as Damsels of the Lady, are powerful, female Bretonnian magic-users and priestesses dedicated to the service of the Lady of the Lake. Grail Damsels are completely outside the laws of Bretonnia and equally outside its social customs. No one would dare to criticise one, even behind her back..
Personal Representative of the Lady and leader of Damsels in earthly matters.
The Knights of Bretonnia are a collection of feudal lords whose devotion to the Lady knows no bounds, and for their service they are greatly rewarded.
Has all the Virtues for your career.
Has been on the Quest of 3 or more years.
You must be knighted to gain the benefits of your new station and the associated trait.
You must be knighted to gain the benefits of your new station and the associated trait.
You must be knighted to gain the benefits of your new station and the associated trait.
Enables §Gright-clicking§! on your own character portrait, in order to take the vow of Chivalry.
Enables §Gright-clicking§! on your own character portrait, in order to take the vow of Knighthood.
Enables §Gright-clicking§! on your own character portrait, to go back on the Quest for the Holy Grail.
Enables §Gright-clicking§! on your own character portrait, in order to upgrade your Virtue of Knighthood.
Enables §Gright-clicking§! on a province you control, in order to levy its farmers to help in your wars.
Enables you to receive the blessings of the Lady.
This knight pursues the Virtue of Chivalry. Every knight must follow a wide-reaching code of conduct.
This knight pursues the Virtue of Audacity. Companion Agilgar of Parravon exemplified this with his daring and cunning when fighting foes much larger than himself.
This knight pursues the Virtue of Confidence. Carleond of Couronne would challenge any foe to a duel, so sure in abilities was he.
This knight pursues the Virtue of Discipline. Marcus of Bordeleaux provided the original example by always facing overwhelming odds with perfect calm and dignity.
This knight pursues the Virtue of Duty. Companion Thierulf of Lyonesse embodied such loyalty, shown in his steadfast duty to Gilles.
This knight pursues the Virtue of Empathy. Martrud of Montfort treated the peasantry well, earning their respect and loyalty.
This knight pursues the Virtue of Heroism. Gilles of Bastonne slew many monsters and pursued them to their darkest lairs, refusing to let such evil blight the innocent.
This knight pursues the Virtue of the Ideal. Landuin of Mousillon embodied all aspects of the true knight - master of combat as well as great wisdom and heroism.
This knight pursues the Virtue of the Impetuous Knight. Companion Balduin of Brionne refused to give the enemy a chance to plan or regroup, and always led the charge himself.
This knight pursues the Virtue of the Joust. Folgar of Artois mastered the lance and other tools of war, winning glory in tournaments and battles.
This knight pursues the Virtue of Knightly Temper. Beren of Gisoreux fought with great aggressiveness, often overwhelming his foe before they could react to his onslaught.
This knight pursues the Virtue of Noble Disdain. Fredemund of Aquitaine had nothing but contempt for those who would use the weapons or tactics of cowards.
This knight pursues the Virtue of the Penitent. Companion Corduin of L'Anguille never forgot those who were lost, but channelled his grief into great acts of valour
This knight pursues the Virtue of Purity. Rademund of Quenelles championed the Lady in all things, winning glory not for himself, but for her.
This knight pursues the Grail Virtue of Stoicism. Lambard of Carcassonne faced many nightmarish creatures, but never showed fear.
This knight pursues the Virtue of the Quest. A special virtue has you renounce the use of Lance and you receive visions that direct your quest.

You are a Knight of Bretonnia
You have taken the Virtue of Chivalry
You have taken a Virtue of Knighthood
You have taken the Virtue of the Quest
You have taken a Grail Virtue of Knighthood
There are rumors of a troll taking peasants and sheeps.
You are on the hunt for the Troll.
You hear rumors that an Orc Warband is raiding the area.
You are on the hunt for the Orc Warband.
You have spoted a black ship in shallow water with a raiding party on the beach.
You have decided to attack the raiding party.
You have been asked to help with saving this Village from Beastmen.
You have decided to help the Village with their Beastmen problem.
As every good knight he should be charitable and donate money to the Lady.
In the decisions menu you'll be able to donate money.

With Bretonnia stabilized your lords and vassals and even they fey enchantress have made their way to the court to ask of you when will you be taking on the Grail Quest to adhere to the Laws of the realm that demand Royarch must be an Grail Knight.
I Shall go on Grail Quest

I have comitted to the under taking of becoming true knight within the ranks of my fellow country men and aim to become an honourable Grail Knight at the end of my journey... yet my familial roots beckon me.
I accept the Lady as the one True God.
I shan't forsake my roots even for The Lady

You are about the take the Virtue of Chivalry, meaning that you'll up hold the Royal Laws of Bretonnia and are subject to them, though this is but a formality as you are already bound to the Royal Laws of Bretonnia.
I don't want to be an officer of the Law
The Knights of Bretonnia aspire to a set of virtues, each exemplified by one of the original Companions of the Grail but all Knights choose one of the Champions as a patron.
The Knights of Bretonnia aspire to a set of virtues, each exemplified by one of the original Companions of the Grail but all Knights choose one of the Champions as a patron.

The Knights of Bretonnia aspire to a set of virtues, each exemplified by one of the original Companions of the Grail but all Knights choose one of the Champions as a patron.
Will you start to follow the visions again, or will you continue to ignore the Lady?
As a knight who pursues the Virtue of Audacity, your patron is Thierulf of Lyonesse who was the most loyal of the Companions, always fighting at the side of his liege.

column3: As a knight who pursues the Virtue of Confidence, your patron is Carleond of Couronne who would challenge any foe to single combat, such was his confidence in his prowess.
As a knight who pursues the Virtue of Discipline, your patron Marcus of Bordeleaux who took the field against any odds, ever undaunted.
As a knight who pursues the Virtue of Duty, your patron Thierulf of Lyonesse who was the most loyal of the Companions, always fighting at the side of his liege.
As a knight who pursues the Virtue of Empathy, your patron Martrud of Montfort who always championed the peasants and was loved by them in return.
As a knight who pursues the Virtue of Heroism, your patron Gilles of Bastonne who was known as the slayer of monsters, renowned for killing creatures of great size.
As a knight who pursues the Virtue of the Ideal, your patron Landuin of Mousillon who was the peerless knight, pure in heart, skilled in arm, and wise in mind. Alas, Mousillon has fallen far.
As a knight who pursues the Virtue of the Impetuous Knight, your patron Balduin of Brionne who was always in the forefront of battle, first to engage with his enemies.
As a knight who pursues the Virtue of the Joust,your patron Folgar of Artois who was unmatched in his skill with the lance.
As a knight who pursues the Virtue of Knightly Temper, your patron Beren of Gisoreux who was ever swift to deal death to his foes, striking twice before they could respond.
As a knight who pursues the Virtue of Noble Disdain, your patron Fredemund of Aquitaine who never lost his contempt for those who used cowardly weapons rather than fighting face-to-face.
As a knight who pursues the Virtue of the Penitent, your patron Corduin of L’Anguille who ever mourned the loss of his beloved to the curse of a hag, yet he fought bravely when summoned.
As a knight who pursues the Virtue of Purity, your patron Rademund of Quenelles who was the most virtuous champion of the Lady, upholding her honour in every battle.
As a knight who pursues the Virtue of Stoicism, your patron Lambard of Carcassonne who stood firm in the face of fear, and his bravery steeled those around him.

column2: I need more time my dear Lady
The Knights of Bretonnia has seen it fit for you to become a Knight of the Realm.
You are now recognized as seeing the Lady's vision and will be allowed to take up the Quest for the Holy Grail.
For whatever reason you have decided to halt your quest for the Holy Grail, be it temporary or permanent.
No, it's is not for the best
While on your travels, a bunch of peasants approach you, begging your assistance in defending their Village from a band of Beastmen. They claim that their Village is deep within the forest next door.
Of course I'll help my subjects
Get away from me you peasant
You holdup in the Village waiting till night, when the hordes of Beastmen come charging out of the forest.

After successfully defending the Village against the Beastmen, the Villagers stage a wild victory celebration and they drag a statue of a hermaphroditic figure to the centre of the village, prostrating themselves before it.
You join in the fun. What harm can come from participating in local culture?
We will take our leave and leave them to their celebration
This cannot be anything good, burn the Village and her people!
We would like for you to donate a small amount of your money to the church to show your generosity.
Of course, for the Lady's glory
The Lady has received your gift and sends her thanks.
After sending in your donation you have confusingy received a small container of soapy water.
What in the name of the Lady is this?

We have come across an unusual story. Sheep and peasants have gone missing, and despite repeated punishments the shepherds insist that they are not lacking in their duties. They claim a foul beast, as tall as a house and reeking like a tannery lurks in the hills, periodically emerging to devour whatever it can catch. After some conference with your retainers you determine it could very well be a troll! Do you want to investigate?
No, I seek greater glories than mere trolls!
You have quested for a long time now, perhaps it is time to return home and see to your responsibilities there?
No, wait... what if there is a dragon over there instead?

After a week of searching, you finally come upon some troll tracks which lead to a dark cave which emanates horrendous smells and sounds. It seems there are more than one after all. Girding yourself as best as you are able, you light some torches and prepare to destroy this threat to the local community.
I dedicate this victory to the Lady!

Your band marches into the troll lair, and though they are strong and ferocious opponents they are no match for your superior knightly valour. Swords cut them to pieces, torches and oil cauterise their wounds, and faith wreathes you like an unbreakable barrier. After slaying half a dozen of them, you take a moment to rest and examine the lair. Though trolls are usually far too stupid to gather treasure and are more likely to simply eat it, for whatever reason these ones had a small pile of loot. Perhaps it was dessert?
Men, advance in the other direction - quickly!

Your band marches into the troll lair, full of pride and zeal, but quickly find yourselves in trouble! Six trolls loom out of the darkness like living nightmares, snatching your retainers up into their maws and ignoring the few wounds you manage to inflict. You are hard pressed to make it back to the exit alive!
No, a mere mob of orcs is an unworthy foe!
You hear rumours that an orc warband is raiding this area. Do you want to investigate?
I hope there's enough for all of us! Onward to glory!
No, wait. I think I see a giant over there, this way men!

After some hard riding you find the trail of destruction left behind and quickly catch up to the orcs. The greenskins seem to be meandering across the countryside, looting and burning at random according to the whims of a larger-looking boss. It's only a small war party of less than two-score orcs with a mob of lesser attendant greenskins, but your band of faithful are but a handful.

The orcs are too unprepared to do more than turn and roar defiance as your band approaches, and you smash into them with your fellow knights in a glorious charge. With lance and sword you drive a deep wedge into their hastily formed ranks. The orcs fight poorly and the boss only slightly more challenging, your lance taking it in the throat before you crush it into the mud. The assorted goblins and snotlings that were following the mob attempt to scatter, with most of them ridden down with ease. It is a righteous slaughter, and their kind will now know the folly of trespassing in these lands!

As soon as you begin to charge the orcs, the boss in control of the mob spots you, shouting and beating his underlings into crude ranks to take the impact. Some of them brace with great shields and pikes, and as your charge is broken you find yourself being attacked from all directions!

As you travel along the coast you spot a sleek black ship moored in the shallow water. On the beach nearby is a dark elf raiding party, and they have captured a number of humans! Surely taken in lightning-quick raids on nearby farms and villages, they are preparing them for transport back to their terrible slave-markets.
The peasants are not my concern.

Your mighty charge takes the foul slavers completely by surprise, and rather than form a line and try to repel you, they make a mad dash for their ships. You slay many of the cowardly elves, and free the captives. The surviving raiders make it back to their vessel and flee, but after taking such losses and failing to carry cargo they are unlikely to return any time soon.
A true knight never turns from danger!

The dark elves have sharp eyes that saw you coming from afar, and quickly form disciplined ranks with tall shields and cruel-looking blades at the ready. Worse still, as you approach the taste of foul magic suffuses the air. An unnaturally pale, lithe sorceress pushes her way to the front of the line, leering at you while performing an arcane ritual, and suddenly the air around you explodes with thunder! When you come to a moment later you realise you've been thrown from your horse and are smoking slightly!
Forwards! To victory! For the Lady!
A surge of righteous anger fills you and you leap back up on your horse, spit the blood from your mouth, couch your lance, and with a great battle cry you charge the foul sorceress and her cohorts!

The Sorceress casts another spell at you, but as her lightning bolt fails to stop you, she turns and runs and the rest follow. You slaughter many of them as they flee for their ship, and free the captives.

You rush the dark elves, but the sorceress merely grins wickedly and hurls another spell at you. Lightning arcs out from her hands once more and strikes you, and you feel excruciating pain as you are once again blasted from your horse. This battle is over!
I'm all alone, no one will know if I just ride away...

You know you are not the bravest of knights, but you do try your best. On a solitary ride through the countryside you come across one of your men-at-arms, his weapon sundered, his shield split and his chest carved open. He manages to gasp out an account between fits of coughing, and before he passes you eventually discern that a Norscan berserker had wandered out of the wilderness, raving and cursing in a crude language and slaughtering anyone he sees. He has already slain twenty good men single-handedly, and judging by the screams just over the hill, he's not far off...
Take the vow of the Quest
Take the Grail vow of Knighthood
You can give up on your guest for the Grail and resume it at another time.
You'll donate a small amount to the church as a sign of your generosity.

The ruler and each Bretonnian Duke can nominate a successor from all the Grail Knights. Elective Succession is very popular with the vassals, but they will not approve if their liege personally holds too many elector titles.
This character belongs to the clergy class of Bretonnia
This character belongs to the aristocracy of Bretonnia
This character is a filthy Bretonnian peasant, best be ignored
The Knights of the Lady can ask her for a gift once a year to help him combat the evils of the world.
The Grail Draught will cure you of any disease, magical or not.
Lady's Mantle grants protection to all under it's effect.
Might of Purity guarantees that your strikes will always be true.
Stout Heart fills your heart with hope so you know what is true.

column15: x#NOT IN THE GAME AT THE MOMENT

column2: Your Spirit will not let your mortal body hold it back.
Lady's Mantle grants protection to all under it effect.
Might of Purity guarantees that your strikes will always be true.
Your heart is filled with hope so you know what is true.
Can only receive a blessing once a year
